SENT.plain: Antithrombin III (AT-III) deficiency may be due to quantitative or qualitative AT-III reduction
The diagnosis of qualitative disorder is suspected when a discrepancy is found between immunological and functional levels of AT-III
Heterogeneity has been hypothesized in both quantitative and qualitative deficiency of AT-III
A technique based on crossed immunoelectrofocusing (CIEF) was applied to investigate molecular variants of AT-III
3 families with low functional and immunological levels of AT-III and 1 family with only a low functional AT-III level were investigated
An abnormal AT-III pattern was found with CIEF in the family with suspected qualitative disorder and in 1 of the families with quantitative disorder
Thus the use of CIEF AT-III patterns could help to define congenital AT-III deficiencies and could serve as a basis for classification of different forms of AT-III deficiency
